Pre-Game Insights: South Africa's loss against Netherlands ensured India's qualification for the final four from Group 2.
India will top Group 2 if they beat Zimbabwe.
Victory against Zimbabwe will set up a semi-final showdown against England in Adelaide on November 10.
India's average opening stand is 13 at a run rate of 4.27, which is the worst among participating teams in the tournament.
Zimbabwe's fast bowlers will test the India openers once again, especially if they are batting first.
Regis Chakabva has struggled in this T20 World Cup, scoring only 45 runs at an average of 6.42 and a strike rate of 77.58.
Sikandar Raza has performed exceptionally well this year, smashing 701 runs in 23 T20Is with an average of 35.05 and a strike rate of 151.40.
